page.title: 15Quaker Farm, Spixworth
page.content: This farm lies on the outer fringes of the area and in part of the larger Grange Farm Estate. The Crook family who farmed it came to Spixworth in 1943 to combine general farming with poultry keeping. The free range flock was especially suitable for the light land in Spixworth. Gradually the farm was increased to its present size of 750 acres plus a further 140 acres of hired land. The emphasis of the farm has changed over the years with the expansion of the dairy herd and by investment in a modern milking parlour and cow buildings. {The Dairy Unit} This was started with about 20 mixed cows hand milked in '42 and now is made up of 300 Friesian cows. They are milked in a rotary herringbone parlour,each giving 1300 gallons on average each year.
